articles.author: Jessica Dickler
articles.title: Despite recession fears and fueled by 'revenge spending,' Americans spend $314 a month on impulse purchases - CNBC
articles.description: A surge in ecommerce and buy now, pay later has led to more spontaneous shopping at a time when budgets are particularly strained.
articles.content:
Impulse buys can quickly erode even the best financial plans.
And yet, between sponsored posts on social media and "revenge spending," they are nearly impossible to avoid.
As the cost of living sur… [+3816 chars]
